item.title: Ipsum
item.description: Nullam et orci eu lorem consequat tincidunt vivamus et sagittis magna sed nunc rhoncus condimentum sem. In efficitur ligula tate urna. Maecenas massa sed magna lacinia magna pellentesque lorem ipsum dolor. Nullam et orci eu lorem consequat tincidunt. Vivamus et sagittis tempus.

item.title: 25 Random Things about Myself
item.description: So far, I have traveled to 30 countries and more than 120 cities in the world. My favorite city is London. It is such a wonderful melting pot, blending all kinds of cultures seamlessly, and the Chinese food there is beyond-words delicious. The rain bothers me a little, though, and so does the British humour that I don’t quite comprehend. I have visited Paris a couple of times but never went to see the cathedral Notre Dame de Paris.

item.title: How political affiliation is translated to Brexit votes
item.description: Fetching data brexit_results <- read_csv(here::here("Data","brexit_results.csv")) brexit_long<-brexit_results%>% pivot_longer( cols=c(con_2015,lab_2015,ld_2015,ukip_2015), names_to="party",values_to="proportion")%>% select(c(Seat,leave_share,party,proportion)) Plotting the chart brexit_graph <- ggplot(brexit_long)+ geom_point(aes(x=proportion,y=leave_share,color=party),alpha=0.4)+ stat_smooth(data=subset(brexit_long,party=="con_2015"), aes(x=proportion,y=leave_share), color="#0087DC", method = "lm", se = T) + stat_smooth(data=subset(brexit_long, party=="lab_2015"), aes(x=proportion,y=leave_share), color="#DC241f", method = "lm", se =T) + stat_smooth(data=subset(brexit_long,party=="ld_2015"), aes(x=proportion,y=leave_share), color="#FDBB30", method = "lm", se = T) + stat_smooth(data=subset(brexit_long,party=="ukip_2015"), aes(x=proportion,y=leave_share), color="#FFFF00", method = "lm", se = T)+ labs( title = "Political Affiliation & Brexit Voting", x = "Party % 2015 general election", y = "Leave % 2016 Brexit referendum", fill = "Party") + scale_color_manual( values = c("#0087DC", "#DC241f", "#FDBB30", "#FFFF00"), labels = c("Conservative", "Labour", "Lib Dems", "UKIP")) + scale_shape_manual(values = c(16, 17)) + guides(linetype = guide_legend(override.

item.title: Mask Acceptance Rate
item.description: NYT mask use Github source for data https://github.com/nytimes/covid-19-data/tree/master/mask-use Getting the data #Source for data url <- "https://github.com/nytimes/covid-19-data/raw/master/mask-use/mask-use-by-county.csv" nyt_mask_survey <- read_csv(url) nyt_mask_survey <- nyt_mask_survey %>% clean_names() %>% mutate( mostly_yes= frequently+always, mostly_no = never+rarely, delta = mostly_yes-mostly_no ) glimpse(nyt_mask_survey) ## Rows: 3,142 ## Columns: 9 ## $ countyfp <chr> "01001", "01003", "01005", "01007", "01009", "01011", "010… ## $ never <dbl> 0.053, 0.083, 0.067, 0.020, 0.053, 0.031, 0.102, 0.152, 0.… ## $ rarely <dbl> 0.
